alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 12:23AM MDT until June 15 at 1:50AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. For the Palouse River...including Potlatch...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Palouse River near Potlatch. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Water will be over Flannigan Creek Road where it crosses the Palouse River just downstream of Potlatch, Idaho. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:46 PM PDT Monday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue rising, and crest near 17.4 feet late tonight, and then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon or night. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 04/10/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1130 AM PDT.
